fields.summary: euca-bundle-vol fails due to /dev/loop0 still being in use

fields.description:
We were trying to run {{euca-bundle-vol}} inside a CentOS 7.1 instance. We used the code available in the master branch as packages are not yet available for the latest euca2ools. 

Following command was given:

{code}
# euca-bundle-vol -r x86_64 -c /home/centos/cert-TLNL3U577YBDBLDRA6ZYTVG2XSEDVMPS.pem -k /home/centos/pk-TLNL3U577YBDBLDRA6ZYTVG2XSEDVMPS.pem --ec2cert /home/centos/cert-TLNL3U577YBDBLDRA6ZYTVG2XSEDVMPS.pem  --user userID -P gpt -d /mnt --size 2048 --debug
{code}

The output of the command:

{code}
2015-06-12 03:06:49,809 DEBUG   BundleVolume parsed arguments: {'generate_fstab': False, 'kernel': None, 'all': False, 'fstab': None, 'part_size': 10485760, 'show_progress': False, 'prefix': None, 'ec2cert': '/home/centos/cert-TLNL3U577YBDBLDRA6ZYTVG2XSEDVMPS.pem', 'exclude': None, 'size': 2048, 'productcodes': [], 'script': None, 'destination': '/mnt', 'grub_config': None, 'include': None, 'ramdisk': None, 'enc_key': None, 'enc_iv': None, 'volume': '/', 'user': 'userID', 'arch': 'x86_64', 'block_device_mappings': None, 'partition': 'gpt', 'privatekey': '/home/centos/pk-TLNL3U577YBDBLDRA6ZYTVG2XSEDVMPS.pem', 'inherit': False, 'no_filter': False, 'cert': '/home/centos/cert-TLNL3U577YBDBLDRA6ZYTVG2XSEDVMPS.pem'}
2015-06-12 03:06:49,811 INFO    Config finding global option default-region
2015-06-12 03:06:49,811 INFO    Config   novalue for default-region
2015-06-12 03:06:49,811 DEBUG   BundleImage certificate: /home/centos/cert-TLNL3U577YBDBLDRA6ZYTVG2XSEDVMPS.pem
2015-06-12 03:06:49,811 DEBUG   BundleImage private key: /home/centos/pk-TLNL3U577YBDBLDRA6ZYTVG2XSEDVMPS.pem
2015-06-12 03:06:49,811 DEBUG   BundleImage cloud certificate: /home/centos/cert-TLNL3U577YBDBLDRA6ZYTVG2XSEDVMPS.pem
2015-06-12 03:06:49,811 DEBUG   BundleImage account ID: userID
1+0 records in
1+0 records out
1048576 bytes (1.0 MB) copied, 0.000945111 s, 1.1 GB/s
Creating new GPT entries.
Warning: The kernel is still using the old partition table.
The new table will be used at the next reboot.
The operation has completed successfully.
Warning: The kernel is still using the old partition table.
The new table will be used at the next reboot.
The operation has completed successfully.
Disk /mnt/image: 4194304 sectors, 2.0 GiB
Logical sector size: 512 bytes
Disk identifier (GUID): CEBDC208-DF80-4124-9CB9-AFC1B506D821
Partition table holds up to 128 entries
First usable sector is 34, last usable sector is 4194270
Partitions will be aligned on 2048-sector boundaries
Total free space is 2014 sectors (1007.0 KiB)

Number  Start (sector)    End (sector)  Size       Code  Name
   1            4096         4194270   2.0 GiB     8300  Image
 128            2048            4095   1024.0 KiB  EF02  BIOS Boot
2015-06-12 03:06:52,502 DEBUG   BundleVolume mapping partitioned image /mnt/image
2015-06-12 03:06:52,754 INFO    BundleVolume creating filesystem on /dev/mapper/loop0p1 using metadata from /dev/xvda1: {'type': 'xfs', 'uuid': '0f790447-ebef-4ca0-b229-d0aa1985d57f'}
2015-06-12 03:06:52,754 INFO    BundleVolume formatting with ``mkfs -t xfs /dev/mapper/loop0p1''
meta-data=/dev/mapper/loop0p1    isize=256    agcount=4, agsize=130943 blks
         =                       sectsz=512   attr=2, projid32bit=1
         =                       crc=0        finobt=0
data     =                       bsize=4096   blocks=523771, imaxpct=25
         =                       sunit=0      swidth=0 blks
naming   =version 2              bsize=4096   ascii-ci=0 ftype=0
log      =internal log           bsize=4096   blocks=2560, version=2
         =                       sectsz=512   sunit=0 blks, lazy-count=1
realtime =none                   extsz=4096   blocks=0, rtextents=0
2015-06-12 03:06:52,948 INFO    BundleVolume formatting with ``xfs_admin -U 0f790447-ebef-4ca0-b229-d0aa1985d57f /dev/mapper/loop0p1''
Clearing log and setting UUID
writing all SBs
new UUID = 0f790447-ebef-4ca0-b229-d0aa1985d57f
2015-06-12 03:06:53,195 INFO    BundleVolume mounting xfs filesystem /dev/mapper/loop0p1 at /mnt/target-V_cKHc
mount: wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on /dev/mapper/loop0p1,
       missing codepage or helper program, or other error

       In some cases useful info is found in syslog - try
       dmesg | tail or so.
2015-06-12 03:06:53,208 DEBUG   BundleVolume unmapping partitioned image /mnt/image
loop deleted : /dev/loop0
euca-bundle-vol: error: Command '['mount', '-t', 'xfs', '/dev/mapper/loop0p1', '/mnt/target-V_cKHc']' returned non-zero exit status 32
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/bin/euca-bundle-vol", line 5, in <module>
    pkg_resources.run_script('euca2ools==3.2.0-52-ga9bfdef', 'euca-bundle-vol')
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pkg_resources.py", line 540, in run_script
    self.require(requires)[0].run_script(script_name, ns)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pkg_resources.py", line 1455, in run_script
    execfile(script_filename, namespace, namespace)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/euca2ools-3.2.0_52_ga9bfdef-py2.7.egg/EGG-INFO/scripts/euca-bundle-vol", line 6, in <module>
    euca2ools.commands.bundle.bundlevolume.BundleVolume.run()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/requestbuilder-0.3.0_pre2-py2.7.egg/requestbuilder/command.py", line 305, in run
    cmd.handle_cli_exception(err)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/requestbuilder-0.3.0_pre2-py2.7.egg/requestbuilder/command.py", line 302, in run
    result = cmd.main()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/euca2ools-3.2.0_52_ga9bfdef-py2.7.egg/euca2ools/commands/bundle/bundlevolume.py", line 171, in main
    self.__create_and_mount_filesystem(device, mountpoint)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/euca2ools-3.2.0_52_ga9bfdef-py2.7.egg/euca2ools/commands/bundle/bundlevolume.py", line 359, in __create_and_mount_filesystem
    mountpoint])
  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/subprocess.py", line 542, in check_call
    raise CalledProcessError(retcode, cmd)
subprocess.CalledProcessError: Command '['mount', '-t', 'xfs', '/dev/mapper/loop0p1', '/mnt/target-V_cKHc']' returned non-zero exit status 32
{code}

It appears we are trying to re-use the UUID for disk {{/dev/xvda1}} in our image but this does not work with xfs. We might have to generate a new UUID after formatting the image with xfs and then mount the image also we might have to replace the old UUID in places like grub config and fstab etc. to reflect the changes.

Cheers,
Deependra
fields.summary: bundlevolume with xfs filesystem fails due to duplicate UUID

comments.body: Fixed in commit {{45b9c78}}.  This is easiest to test on RHEL 7, whose default filesystem is XFS.

# Set up Eucalyptus 4.3.1 cloud with VPC
# Launched [CentOS 7 cloud image|http://cloud.centos.org/centos/7/images/CentOS-7-x86_64-GenericCloud.qcow2.xz] from emis.eucalyptus.com
# Created volume and attached it to the running instance
{code}
[root@d-14 ~]# euca-describe-instances i-1b2d9a7a --region qa-admin@drake
RESERVATION	r-570fa485	001769317121	default
INSTANCE	i-1b2d9a7a	emi-e92e93bd	euca-10-116-131-225.eucalyptus.h-02.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-172-31-15-149.eucalyptus.internal	running	qa-admin	0		m1.medium	2016-12-09T16:39:27.391Z	views				monitoring-disabled	10.116.131.225	172.31.15.149	vpc-668c98f0	subnet-673fa56a	instance-store					hvm			sg-90c75de9				x86_64
BLOCKDEVICE	/dev/sdd	vol-8711962f	2016-12-09T21:14:58.771Z	false
NETWORKINTERFACE	eni-41cc3aca	subnet-673fa56a	vpc-668c98f0	001769317121	in-use	172.31.15.149	euca-172-31-15-149.eucalyptus.internal	true
ATTACHMENT		eni-attach-d5eb6790	0	attached	2016-12-09T16:39:27.395Z	true
ASSOCIATION	10.116.131.225		172.31.15.149
GROUP	sg-90c75de9	default
PRIVATEIPADDRESS	172.31.15.149	euca-172-31-15-149.eucalyptus.internal	primary
TAG	instance	i-1b2d9a7a	OS	CentOS Linux release 7.2.1511
{code}
# Copied X509 certificates to instance, then SSH'd into the instance and installed euca2ools from nightly repo.
# Formatted block device associated with attached volume, mounted volume to {{/centos-bundle}}, then ran {{euca-bundle-vol}}:
{code}
[root@euca-172-31-15-149 ~]# euca-bundle-vol -k /tmp/cert/qa-admin-cert-pk.pem -c /tmp/cert/qa-admin-cert.pem -u 001769317121 -r x86_64 -e /tmp/cert,/centos-bundle,/root/.euca -d /centos-bundle --partition mbr --region qa-admin@drake
1+0 records in
1+0 records out
1048576 bytes (1.0 MB) copied, 0.00214017 s, 490 MB/s
Warning: The resulting partition is not properly aligned for best performance.

Number  Start  End        Size       Type     File system  Flags

meta-data=/dev/mapper/loop0p1    isize=256    agcount=4, agsize=655358 blks
         =                       sectsz=512   attr=2, projid32bit=1

data     =                       bsize=4096   blocks=2621432, imaxpct=25

naming   =version 2              bsize=4096   ascii-ci=0 ftype=0
log      =internal log           bsize=4096   blocks=2560, version=2
         =                       sectsz=512   sunit=0 blks, lazy-count=1
realtime =none                   extsz=4096   blocks=0, rtextents=0

Ran into TOOLS-671 issue.
